intro: Delissea quercifolia, commonly known as the oak-leaf delissea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the southeastern United States, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. The plant is characterized by its palmate, lobed leaves that resemble those of an oak tree, giving it its common name. Delissea quercifolia produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
